text: DoReMi Market (), also known as Amazing Saturday (), is a South Korean television program that airs on tvN. It currently stars Shin Dong-yup, Kim Dong-hyun, Moon Se-yoon, Park Na-rae, Hyeri (Girl's Day), Nucksal and P.O (Block B), with Boom as the main host. The program airs every Saturday at 19:35 (KST) starting from April 7, 2018. Nucksal and P.O (Block B) joined the show starting from episode 52 to replace Hanhae and Key (SHINee), who were confirmed to enlist in the army on February 7 and March 4, 2019 respectively. Hanhae and Key officially left after episode 47 and episode 51 respectively, following military enlistments. On October 20, 2020 tvN confirmed that Hyeri (Girl's Day) will be leaving the show, with her last episode expected to be in end November. Hanhae and Key (SHINee) were confirmed to return to the show, and Taeyeon (Girls' Generation) will also join the show. ==Program== In each episode, a market from South Korea is featured and within it there are 3 types of food selected as its representatives. The cast and guest(s), as contestants, have to play games and win to be able to enjoy the food. There will be a dressing theme concept for the cast and guest(s) to follow for filming of each episode. For episodes 1–4, the program format is only 3 rounds of song dictation. From episode 5, the program format changed to 2 rounds of song dictation, with a Snack Time in between the dictation segments. ===Games Played=== Song Dictation: Viewers can recommend songs and the specific part of the song recommended on the show's official website for use in the show. Contestants have to work together to note down all the correct characters that was being sung in a small part of the song chosen to play. For each song, they will be given only three attempts to get all the correct lyrics, otherwise it would be deemed as failed. For every failed attempt, the food will be consumed by Mukbang YouTuber Small-mouthed Haetnim. On failing their first attempt, the portion of the food to be shared by all contestants would be cut by half, and on failing their second attempt, the portion of the food reduces to only 1-2 servings. If they have completely failed, no food would be given. For each attempt, a representative from the contestants would go up and present their answer, and if the answer is wrong, the representative gets the punishment. Chances from Boom are available for use on all three attempts. The chances can be used singly, but in a round the same chance cannot be used twice. Beginning episode 124, the Chance Board will display the number of times contestants can listen to the part of the song again after using a chance from the Chance Board. * Basic Chances (given by Boom on the first attempt): ** One Shot (for the contestant(s) who has the closest answer to the correct answer) ** Number of words ** Song information ** Lyrics before and after the part used ** Test of existence and number of English characters and numbers ** Fool Fool Boom Fool: This chance was introduced in episode 89. Only one question, of any content, can be asked to Boom, and he can only answer yes or no. * Chance Board (Current): ** All Spaces: All the spaces for the lyrics used will be shown. ** One Character: A character of the lyrics used (that is requested) will be shown. ** Two Consonants: This chance was introduced in episode 54. Consonants of two characters of the lyrics used (that are requested) will be shown. ** Number of Wrong Characters: This chance was introduced in episode 6. The number of wrong characters will be known. ** Slow (70%) Hearing: This chance was introduced in the second round of episode 46, where it temporarily replaced All Space. It became a fixed chance starting episode 54. The song will be played at 70% of the normal playback speed. ** 1/5 Seconds: This chance was introduced in episode 89. All the characters of the lyrics are jumbled up and is only shown on display for 0.2 seconds. As there is a high success rate after using this chance, a change to this chance was made starting from episode 95. After using this chance, there is no possibility of listening to the part of the song again. * Other Chances: ** Listen Again Chance: The part of the song is repeated again. This chance can only be used once either in Song 1 or Song 2. ** Boom Car Service: This chance can only be used on the third attempt with limited number of uses. This is a descriptive chance, where the smooth sound of the car is played on the parts that are correctly answered, and the sound of the car crashed is played on the wrong part of the lyrics answered. ** Acting Chance: Boom acts to describe the lyrics of the song. ** Live Chance: The live version of the song used is played. Snack Time: Different from the Song Dictation segment, this is an individual battle where only the last placing contestant won't get to eat the snack. *New/Old Neologism Quiz: Answer the full phrase of the neologism that is given as question. *North Korean Cultural Quiz: Answer the word/sentence, which is said in North Korean dialect, in South Korean dialect. *New/Old OST Quiz: Answer the correct name of the movie/drama based on its original soundtrack. *What Is This Food?: Answer the correct food based on its close- up. *Voice Support Quiz: Answer the correct line(s) based on a scene of a drama/movie/advertisement/variety show. *Your Eyes, Nose, Lips Quiz: Answer the correct celebrity based on separate pictures of his/her eyes, nose and lips. *Consonants Quiz: Answer the correct term based on its consonants, normally of a specific theme. *Love Love Couple Quiz: Answer the correct couple name based on the character(s) in a drama/manga given as question. The second type of this quiz is to answer the other half of the couple based on one half of the couple being shown. *Find The Fanclub Owner: Answer the correct celebrity based on the fanclub name given as question. *New/Old Game BGM Quiz: Answer the correct game name based on its background music or sound effects. The game can be of an online game or a mobile phone game. *Translator Quiz: Answer the correct sentence that was originally being said through an online translator, which has a foreign accent. *Dictionary Battle: Answer the correct term based on its definition from the Standard Korean Language Dictionary. *Lyrics Reading Quiz: Answer the correct singer and the song title from listening to its lyrics being read out. *Doppelganger Quiz: Answer the two correct drama titles based on 2 different styles of the same actor/actress in the dramas given as question. There is also a Singers version and a Variety version of this game. *Dialect Tour: Answer the correct song title and its singer based on one of the Eight Provinces of Korea dialect translations for the song title given as question. *I Can See Your Title: Answer the correct movie or drama title based on its promotional poster. *Find The Original Singer: Listen to a cover version of a song and answer the original singer and the song name. *Face/Off: Answer the correct celebrity based on a picture of him/her which has the gender of the celebrity swapped. *Find The Hidden Real Name: Answer the correct celebrity based on his/her real name given as question. *Noraebang Accompaniment Quiz: Answer the correct song title and its singer based on the Noraebang accompaniment of the song. *Character Expression Quiz: Answer the correct celebrity based on the title or nickname used to express him/her. *Choreography Décalcomanie Quiz: Answer the two correct singers and the two songs based on two photos of a similar choreography or movement. *Relation Between The Two?: Answer the correct relation between two people in a movie/drama/animation. *What's Your Name?: Answer the correct name of the person/thing based on a picture of it. *Lyrics Feeling Drama Quiz: Answer the correct song title and its singer based on its lyrics being read out like a drama line. This is also known as the opposite version of the Lyrics Reading Quiz. *Guess Them Right! Homes: Answer the correct movie/drama/animation/variety show based on the house that was shown in the background, or from the interior in the picture. *Gag Corner Title Quiz: Answer the correct name of the corner of a gag program based on a scene of it. ==Cast== ===Current=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !
